intro: Lonchestigma, commonly known as the golden cup-mud. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release its seeds, often found in dry, sandy soils. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
